title: Hawaiian business goes viral for sign blasting Joe Biden's tone-deaf visit: "It's not always about you"
description:
Joe Biden's trip to Maui was embarrassing even by Joe Biden standards. The highlight was when he told people who lost everything in a wildfire that he knew the feeling... because a kitchen fire almost ruined his Corvette. The media was outraged because Republicans seized on such an "empathetic" and would dare politicize such an event. Do you know who is more outraged at Biden? Hawaiians.

One business is going viral for a sign blasting the tone-deaf president and reminding him that not everything is about him.

Here's the offending video:

— (@)

Besides being tone-deaf, it's also b-b-b-bullsh*t. Lighting struck his house, it caused a small fire in his kitchen, and it was dealt with within twenty minutes. In comparison, it had been 10,080 minutes since Biden's first "no comment" to when he finally addressed the victims of the Maui Wildfire.

Hawaiian Rent-All was disgusted with Biden's contrived empathy. A new sign in front of their building reading "Sorry you almost lost your '67 Corvette in a fire, Mr. President" has gone viral for its more sarcastic "empathy" in finger quotes.

It's a good thing for Biden that he isn't Republican. This story would be all over CNN and retweeted by every Leftist celebrity whose PR team got a memo asking "Hey, please tweet this."

As would this woman Lahaina from earlier today telling Biden to go f*ck himself.

— (@)

Biden is, I think, returning from vacation on Monday. We'll see how much more money he sends to Ukraine. And how much content the media can create about ungrateful Hawaiians attacking a president who gave them all $700.

>

<

title: School board orders security to forcibly remove father reading from book in kid's library: "Who wants to touch my weiner?"
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

Outrage erupted from a Texas school board meeting where a man was removed for questioning the smut that was available in the school library. The Fort Worth school board that allowed the material in the school library, even encouraged it to be there, did not think that same material was appropriate to be read in front of adults.

The man had a copy of Penthouse that was available in the school library, and read from a forum letter "Who wants to touch my weiner" before the angry chairwoman started banging her gavel and called for security.

— (@)

Why Forth Worth ISD has a collection of Penthouse magazines in the school library, and for what educational purposes...

Sorry, I'm getting word I have that wrong. it was NOT a copy of Penthouse. It was an award-winning graphic novel called Flamer that was written by a gay dude. That means it is not porn as much as it is tolerance and equity. Here is the author claiming his book is banned. Even though if you ordered it on Amazon you could probably get it by dinner time.

— (@)

Fox News reports the novel is semi-autobiographical and about a boy bullied at a Boy Scouts summer camp for, and this is a quote, "acting in a manner considered stereotypical of gay men." Per the book, that appears to mean passing around a soda bottle, ejaculating in it, and then the person who doesn't ejaculate gets to drink from the bottle filled with everyone else's... I think you get the point.

— (@)

School boards have conducted studies and found the most effective way to promote "inclusion" and "tolerance" is with explicit comic books that introduce kids to tasting their vagina slime, teaching them the proper techniques of giving a "handy," and showing them a graphic play-by-play of two dudes f*cking. But the books HAVE to be written by an L, G, B, T, and/or Q. And they HAVE to be award-winning, which of course they are because they were written by an L, G, B, T, and/or Q.

Books written about the same topic by straight people -- especially cis white males -- are still considered inappropriate and gross. And unsuitable for public schools.

>

title: Warning: Joe Biden's alcohol CZAR wants to limit how much beer you should drink a week
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

This is the worst thing to happen to beer since Dylan Mulvaney.

Joe Biden hasn't f*cked up America enough. Now he wants to f*ck up how you get f*cked up trying to forget how much he f*cked up. His alcohol czar -- yes, he has an alcohol czar - wants to change the recommendation for how much beer you should be allowed.

Let me be clear -- since the "independent" "fact" checkers get uppity when we have too much fun -- no one is calling on a ban of how much hooch you can drink (yet). But alcohol czar Dr. George Koob wants new "guidelines."

President Biden’s alcohol czar, Dr. George Koob, told the Daily Mail that the USDA could revise its alcohol recommendations to match Canada’s guidelines.
In January, the Great White North began urging residents to limit their alcohol consumption to two drinks per week.

I'm about to have more than my allotted weekly recommendation in a single glass of bourbon.

This is why we tell you "Pay attention, America." The bad ideas that start in Canada and Europe wind up the wet dreams of leftists in this country. We warned you about what Canada was doing in January. This patriot wasn't having it.

— (@)

The Biden Administration isn't regulating you to only two drinks a week. It is only offering a "guidance." In a perfect world, we could just ignore the government's guidance as we've done for decades. Here's the rub with that.

The school mask mandates? Those were a "guidance." One that was enforced for political reasons, even though schools "didn't" have to follow them.

The people who demanded they be followed? They tend to come from the same ideology that wants to control how you feed your family or heat your house.

But, again, I can't stress this enough, NO ONE at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website is saying that Joe Biden and the regime want to regulate your booze. We are ONLY pointing out that Biden's alcohol czar wants to offer a suggestion.

And also, Biden has an alcohol czar.

>

<

title: Defying leftist attacks, the abortion survivor Ron DeSantis mentioned at the debate is sharing her story
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

Joe Biden is making his pro-abortion stance front and center of the Democrat Party's 2024 campaign. Democrats are so extreme, they want to change the definition of "heartbeat." So when Ron DeSantis brought up the fetal heartbeat bill he has passed in Florida, drawing from a specific abortion survivor he met, the media went on the attack.

"Does she exist?" "Ludicrous and obviously untrue." "DeSantis/Fetus left in a pan 2024."

— (@)


Here's some of the responses this provoked: pic.twitter.com/ElxVhptfvk
— Mary Margaret Olohan (@MaryMargOlohan) August 24, 2023

Except Miriam “Penny” Hopper is real. She says she did survive an abortion. And she shared her story with The Daily Signal.

“He induced the abortion by giving my mother a shot. He looked at both my parents, and he said, ‘You do not want this baby to live. If it lives, it will be a burden on you the rest of your lives.’ Before returning home, he looked at the nurse, and he gave her orders to discard the baby, dead or alive.”

“My grandmother and my aunt Ruby came down to visit with my mother. My grandmother, later described by my father, went into orbit when she found out I was alive. She was so upset about the circumstances that she contacted local police. The nurse who cared for my mother volunteered to transport me to Morrell Hospital in Lakeland, Florida.”

“I remained in the hospital until March 12, 1956, and according to my mother, that was the first time she had ever held me. My father passed away in 2011, but before he passed away, he looked at me and said, ‘Honey, I don’t know what I would have done without you.’”

Penny: "No matter what circumstances my parents were facing surrounding my mother’s pregnancy, I ended up having great parents...I ended up marrying my high-school sweetheart. I have two children and seven grandchildren."

"Life has value, and all lives matter.” pic.twitter.com/do8BvoYHze
— Mary Margaret Olohan (@MaryMargOlohan) August 24, 2023

Republicans have a slight problem on their hands that I saw expressed on X. The Democrat position on abortion is so extreme, that moderate and independent voters believe it sounds like Republicans are lying when we accurately describe the Democrat Party's extreme position.

We need to keep hammering it home with specific example after specific example after specific example. Like how there are 100 times more babies murdered in late-term abortions than there are the number of mass shooting deaths.

The law Joe Biden is basing his entire reelection campaign around, the so-called Women's "Health" Protection Act would expand abortion up until birth, overturn 500 different state laws, eliminate religious exemptions, and otherwise solidify America as one of the abortion capitals of the world. Unlike most of Europe, who believe, at some point, you have to admit it's a baby.

If Biden and the Democrats have their way, tens of thousands of people just like Penny will lose their lives every year. THAT is the extreme position.

>

<

title: "Transgenderism a fad": Rock icon Alice Cooper destroys left-wing push to confuse children about their sexuality
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

Rock legend Alice Cooper is speaking out against the Left's radical gender ideology they want to indoctrinate your kids with. Well, "speaking out" is the wrong word. He answered a question in an interview that was supposed to be about his twenty-ninth studio album "Road." Had he not gotten the question, I'm sure Alice Cooper would have been fine just being Alice Cooper.

Stereogum tossed out the following as a question. No doubt, the reporter was expecting Cooper to blast his peers and affirm the reporter's political worldview

Recently some of your “theatrical” rock peers have commented about gender identity, with Paul Stanley and Dee Snider calling gender-affirming care for kids a “sad and dangerous fad.” As someone who played around with gender expectations early on, do you have any thoughts on what some of your contemporaries have said before they walked those comments back?

There are a few errors here. The first is you should research the person you are interviewing before the interview. Had this guy done this, he would know Alice Cooper is not the same guy he was in 1974.

Also, Dee Snider did not walk his comments back. Only Paul Stanley did. The Starchild went from crushing pussy in the 70s to being one in his 70s.

Here's Cooper's response:

I’m afraid that it’s also a fad, and I’m afraid there’s a lot of people claiming to be this just because they want to be that. I find it wrong when you’ve got a six-year-old kid who has no idea. He just wants to play, and you’re confusing him telling him, “Yeah, you’re a boy, but you could be a girl if you want to be.”
I think that’s so confusing to a kid. It’s even confusing to a teenager. You’re still trying to find your identity, and yet here’s this thing going on, saying, “Yeah, but you can be anything you want. You can be a cat if you want to be.” I mean, if you identify as a tree… And I’m going, “Come on! What are we in, a Kurt Vonnegut novel?” It’s so absurd, that it’s gone now to the point of absurdity.

Two things. Actually, three things. The first is obviously everything Alice Cooper says is spot on.

Two, is this a new thing we're going to do when interviewing veteran rock stars? Two people had an opinion, so everyone who they may have toured with has to be on record whether or not they denounce that opinion. This is rock journalism now. Quick, get the lead singer of Kansas on the phone. We need to know if the son in "Carry On Wayward Son" identifies as a girl and is competing in high school track.

Third, and far more important than anything else, the following is the Mount Rushmore of Alice Cooper songs: "Poison (1989)," "Only Women Bleed (1975)", "No More Mr. Nice Guy (1973)," and "Hello Hooray (1973)."

>

<

title: Maui resident who lost everything offers harsh message for Joe Biden: "Get back on the f***ing plane"
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

American citizens in Maui have lost everything, including their lives, due to the wildfires caused by government incompetence. When Joe Biden, the incompetent head of the government, left vacation to visit the island, the residents were not impressed. Biden is now back on vacation, and Republicans are seizing on the fallout.

(Hi, it's me. I'm the Republicans. It's me)

Fallout, like comments made by this resident who lost everything, including her pets, her medication, and all of her money that was in her house. She would like Joe Biden to take the whole $700 he is handing out and stick it up his nose.

"I think Joe Biden should take his $700 and get back on the f*cking plane and go home. That's what I think. $700 compared to all the millions he's giving to Ukraine. That's why we don't understand. We're citizens and we cannot get money. But if they're not citizens they get gazillions of dollars from the USA."

— (@)

She is talking about the $700 Joe Biden bragged about giving Maui residents to rebuild their lives. Though, regretfully, this woman needs to be fact-checked. America has not given Ukraine a gazillion dollars. America has only given Ukraine $113,000,000,000. That is a lot less than a gazillion. It breaks down to $2500 per PERSON in Ukraine. Veruses the $700 Biden is handing out per Maui household.

— (@)

At least this woman has her life. Other Maui residents do not. The ones who IGNORED the government still do. People who believed the government was looking out for them died in a car fire.

— (@)

President Biden has listened to this woman and gotten back on the plane. After a visit that was embarrassing even by Joe Biden standards.

As of this writing, there haven't been any news reports yet on Maui residents being pro-Putin over questioning how much money we keep sending to Ukraine. Emphasis on "yet." I haven't had CNN on this morning.

>

<

title: Legendary rock guitarist expresses common sense views on gender and... yep, there's his apology
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

My new rule for when "celebrity says there are two genders" is to wait a day to write about it. I don't want another Paul Stanley incident where he apologizes the next day. It's why I didn't touch this Carlos Santana story yesterday. However, it did get the guitar lick from "Maria Maria" stuck in my head. So that was nice.

Not the song from the movie. This Maria Maria only reminds me of a West Side story.

Santana was performing in New Jersey where he wanted to speak out on the hot-button issue. He also announced he was standing in solidarity with Dave Chappelle. Chappelle is best known for being Vice Transphobe In Charge behind head honcho JK Rowling.

“When God made you and me, before we came out of the womb, you know who you are and what you are. Later on, when you grow out of it, you see things, and you start believing that you could be something that sounds good, but you know it ain’t right. Because a woman is a woman and a man is a man. That’s it. Whatever you wanna do in the closet, that’s your business. I’m OK with that.”

— (@)

Even though he uttered the word "God," everything Santana said was based on science and biology. It may have been surprising in New Jersey where they demand middle schools teach your kids about butt sex. But it was a Santana audience. They're all old enough to remember when girls were girls and men were men. And the men weren't looking to share bathrooms with the girls.

But I know that you know what comes next. The clip was posted on the former bird app. Randos dropped X complaining about it. Journalismers like CNN used that as an excuse to create "the internet says famous person is a transphobe" content. Aaaaaaand... "I sincerely apologize to the transgender community and everyone I offended..."

If this PR-written apology that Carlos most likely doesn't know "Team Santana" posted on his Facebook page sounds familiar, it follows the same formula as the apology posted on behalf of R&B singer Ne-Yo. The difference is Ne-yo was quick to throw his PR team under the bus for it.

— (@)

Congrats to everyone on Team Confusing Kids At As Early An Age As Possible. You scored a PR written apology in record time.

>

<
